page.title: 06 Railways.
page.content: } There is a single-track railway running through our area. It is a main line from Weymouth to Yeovil. It is part of the Great Western line and has always been threatened with closure. At this time of the year the summer excursions are run from Bristol, Birmingham and the Midlands to Weymouth so it looks busy but for the rest of the year, not many people use it. The line skirts the villages of Bradford Peverell & Charminster and follows an embankment crossing the River Frome at places. There is a long tunnel cut through the chalk which takes the line through Poundbury into Dorchester West station which is now unmanned, just a few years ago it used to be a busy station.
